title: Policies | Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art
cleaned_text: A world-class collection of American art, stunning architecture, and 120 acres of Ozark forest with five miles of trails. Admission to the museum is always free. Planning a visit to Crystal Bridges this spring? Use this guide to learn what's on and what to expect this season. We have something for all types of learners. From educator resources to family activities to scholars, find what speaks to you and engage with us. There's more to the museum than just the galleries— come enjoy hands-on creative fun with art classes for all ages and experience levels.. Find opportunities to give and keep art accessible to all, become a member, or join our team. Crystal Bridges members receive year-round perks, invitations to member-only events, travel opportunities, and more! Museum & Buildings Trails and Grounds open daily sunrise to sunset. Museum Visitation Effective March 2, 2022, face coverings are optional for all visitors per new CDC guidelines. Please note that some events may still require masks and proof of vaccination based on artist requirements. Public Programs Individual program safety requirements may vary by location, capacity, and other factors. Please see individual program descriptions for more information. All ticket sales are final and non-refundable. In the event of a museum closing or cancellation of a program, guest ticket orders will be refunded. Call the Inclement Weather line to check on any cancellations: (479) 657-2488. Exchanges of equal value may be made prior to five business days from the ticketed event. However, ticket availability for alternate dates is not guaranteed. Tickets are sold on a first-come, first-served basis. Memberships are non-refundable and non-transferable. Become a member! Exchanges may be made at the Guest Services desk or by calling Guest Services at (479) 657-2335. Our tickets are issued and subject to our Privacy Policy and Terms and Conditions of Use. What if I need to cancel my enrollment for a class or workshop? Can I get a refund? Enrollment fees are refunded if the cancellation is made more than five business days prior to the class or workshop. Please note: No refunds are issued if the cancellation is made less than five business days prior to a class or workshop. If I need to cancel my enrollment, can I receive credit to attend another class in the future? We do not issue class credits toward future sessions; however a refund is issued if the cancellation is made more than five business days prior to the class or workshop (see previous question). What if I need to switch my enrollment to a different class? Exchanges of equal value may be made prior to five business days from the ticketed event. However, ticket availability for alternate dates is not guaranteed and is subject to a first-come, first-served basis. If class fees are not equal, a full refund will be made for the canceled class, and a new order will be processed for the alternate class. What if a class is canceled? Classes that do not reach minimum enrollment will be canceled and fees will be fully refunded. What if I lost, damaged, or could not print my ticket? An original receipt or order number will be required to provide a replacement ticket. Print your confirmation email, or write down the order number provided in the confirmation email. Please present this at the Guest Services desk or call Guest Services at (479) 657-2335. Who do I contact if I have technical difficulties ordering tickets online? Please call Guest Services at (479) 657-2335. Due to high call volume, please leave a detailed message, and your call will be returned in the order it was received.
